definitions.definition: A game (originally Chinese) for four players, using a collection of tiles divided into five or six suits.
A solitaire game using the same tiles, where the player wins by removing pairs of matching exposed tiles until none remain.
To make longer, to extend the length of.
To become longer.
definitions.example: The shadows on the lawn lengthened as the sun began to set.

definitions.definition: The process of growing longer.
A type of sound change when a sound (especially a vowel) lengthens
To make taut; to tauten, to tighten.
Under tension, like a stretched bowstring, rope, or sail; tight.
(of a body, muscles, etc.) Not flabby; firm, toned; (of a person) having a lean, strong body.
(of music, writing, etc.) Containing only relevant parts; brief and controlled.
Experiencing anxiety or stress.
(of a sailor, a ship, etc.) Neat and well-disciplined; (by extension) efficient and in order.
Strong; uncompromising.
A genre of riddles where the clues to the answer are descriptions or puns on its syllables, with a final clue to the whole.
A single round of the game charades, an acted form of the earlier riddles.
A play resembling the game charades, particularly due to poor acting.
A deception or pretense, originally an absurdly obvious one but now in general use.
definitions.example: This whole charade is absurd.

definitions.definition: To act out a charade (of); to gesture; to pretend.
A spool or cylinder around which wire is coiled.
In a sewing machine, the small spool that holds the lower thread.
definitions.example: Wind the bobbin, place it in the machine, and raise the thread.

definitions.definition: The little rounded piece of wood at the end of a latch string, which is pulled to raise the latch.
(haberdashery) A fine cord or narrow braid.
A toddler, a young child.
Clothing made to be worn by dancers, such as leotards and ballet shoes.
To equip something with machinery.
To equip a military unit with tanks and other armed vehicles.
To make something routine, automatic or monotonous.
Equipped with machinery.
Equipped with armoured motor vehicles; compare motorized.
To assign again or anew.
definitions.example: The offending employees were reassigned after the incident.

definitions.definition: To transfer back what was previously assigned.
The light-colored, orangish head of foam on a cup of espresso.
A Mexican foodstuff, the Mexican version of crème fraîche or sour cream.
A deed or action, especially when somebody is held responsible for it.
definitions.example: This is his doing. (= "He did it.")

definitions.definition: Any of the many small fluid-filled sacs located at the point where a muscle or tendon slides across bone. These sacs serve to reduce friction between the two moving surfaces.
A person who, as a profession, profits from large financial transactions.
A company that does the same.
One charged with the administration of finance; an officer who administers the public revenue; a treasurer.
A light, spongy teacake, usually based on almond flour or flavoring.

A traditional French (Ragoût a la Financière) or Piemontese (Finanziera alla piemontese) rich sauce or ragout, made with coxcomb, wattles, cock's testicles, chicken livers and a variety of other ingredients.
The state of being foolish.
A thing or event that is foolish, or an absurdity.
The process in which mixtures are separated using the centripetal force generated by spinning in a centrifuge
The joint made by welding.
To join two materials (especially two metals) together by applying heat, pressure and filler, either separately or in any combination.
To bind together inseparably; to unite closely or intimately.
To wield.
Unambiguous; without equivocation or ambiguity; singularly clear, unmistakable, or unquestionable
definitions.example: I want you to give me an unequivocal guarantee on that.

definitions.definition: (possibly obsolete) Without equal, matchless.
definitions.example: the unequivocal scope of the Golden Gate Bridge

definitions.definition: The act or process of rearranging. See reorganize.
The end result of such an act.
A cluster of heterogeneous things.
A corporation formed by the combination of several smaller corporations whose activities are unrelated to the corporation's primary activity.
A rock consisting of gravel or pebbles embedded in a matrix.
A device for removing the moisture content from air
A small vehicle often used to carry loads and material around, often on building sites.
A dropper of refuse, particularly not in landfill sites/recycling sites.
One who dumps a boyfriend or girlfriend; the one of a romantic couple who terminates the relationship.
A wave that knocks a surfer into the water.
A program that outputs the contents of storage or a data structure.
Kicking where the football is dropped and kicked as it touches the ground.
(pro wrestling) a kick made to the opponent by leaping into the air and dropping down on them.
To score via a dropkick
To make a dropkick
To render silken or silklike.
definitions.example: silkening body lotion

definitions.definition: Made of silk.
definitions.example: a silken veil

definitions.definition: Having a smooth, soft, or light texture, like that of silk; suggestive of silk.
(of speech, singing, oratory, etc.) Smoothly uttered; flowing, subtle, or convincing in presentation.
Dressed in silk.
Any polymer having the elastic properties of rubber
Acanthocybium solandri, a tropical and subtropical game fish.
The winged elm, Ulmus alata.
Euonymus atropurpureus, an eastern burning bush.
(of words) A word or phrase that is created by rearranging the letters of another word or phrase.
definitions.example: The word "silent" is an anagram of "listen".

definitions.definition: To form anagrams.
To put (items) on a string.
definitions.example: You can string these beads on to this cord to make a colorful necklace.

definitions.definition: To put strings on (something).
definitions.example: It is difficult to string a tennis racket properly.

definitions.definition: To form into a string or strings, as a substance which is stretched, or people who are moving along, etc.
To drive the ball against the end of the table and back, in order to determine which player is to open the game.

To deliberately state that a certain bird is present when it is not; to knowingly mislead other birders about the occurrence of a bird, especially a rarity; to misidentify a common bird as a rare species.
The act by which something is strung.
Interesting enough to be reported as a news
The process of making something sensitive.
Having an increased state of activity
Having attention deficit disorder (no longer used by the scientific community)
To make advance with force.
definitions.example: We thrust at the enemy with our forces.

definitions.definition: To force something upon someone.
definitions.example: I asked her not to thrust the responsibility on me.

definitions.definition: To push out or extend rapidly or powerfully.
definitions.example: He thrust his arm into the icy stream and grabbed a wriggling fish, astounding the observers.

definitions.definition: The motion by which someone or something thrusts.
The act of squeezing curd by hand, to expel the whey.
The white whey, or that which is last pressed out of the curd by the hand, and of which butter is sometimes made.
To furnish with a pavilion.
To put inside a pavilion.
To enclose or surround (after Robert Grant's hymn line "pavilioned in splendour").
Occurring or existing before birth
Any of several hereditary illnesses that impair the body's ability to control bleeding, usually passed from mother to son.
The kola plant, genus Cola, famous for its nut, or one of these nuts.
A beverage or a drink made with kola nut flavoring, caramel and carbonated water.
A tree, genus Cola, bearing large brown seeds ("nuts") that are the source of cola extract.
A nut of this tree.
To give new life, energy, activity or success to something.
definitions.example: Japanese investment has revitalised this part of Britain!

definitions.definition: To rouse from a state of inactivity or quiescence.
To hold very tightly, as to not fall off.
definitions.example: Seaweed clung to the anchor.

definitions.definition: To adhere to an object, without being affixed, in such a way as to follow its contours. Used especially of fabrics and films.
To cause to adhere to, especially by twining round or embracing.
To cause to dry up or wither.
To dry up or wither.
definitions.example: Wood clings.

definitions.definition: (with preposition to) to be fond of, to feel strongly about and dependent on
Wasted away; shrunken
The process by which a liquid leaks through a porous substance; the process of seeping.
Water that has seeped or oozed through a porous soil.
Haste; diligence.
To hasten; to go quickly, to hurry.
To hurry (oneself).
A philosophy that rejects the use of violence, and instead seeks to bring about change through peaceful responses even to violent acts.
To convey, imply, or profess outwardly (often falsely).

definitions.definition: (construed with to) To intend.
definitions.example: He purported to become an international man of affairs.

definitions.definition: Worldwide, global.
Not using brushes, of a motor that does not use physical contacts for the commutator.
Not requiring the use of a brush.

definitions.definition: A process of colour cinematography using synchronised monochrome films, each of a different colour, to produce a colour print.
Vivid colour.
A collection of theories based on quantum chromodynamics
Extremely or excessively colourful
Describing something in a technicolor model, a model that is similar to the Standard model but lacks a scalar Higgs field.
In a needless manner
To a degree or extent beyond what is needed
definitions.example: He was always needlessly anxious about his dog.

definitions.definition: Without need
definitions.example: He worried needlessly about his dog.

definitions.definition: To restore (someone) to their former state, reputation, possessions, status etc.
To vindicate; to restore the reputation or image of (a person, concept etc.).
To return (something) to its original condition.
To restore or repair (a vehicle, building); to make habitable or usable again.
To restore to (a criminal etc.) the necessary training and education to allow for a successful reintegration into society; to retrain.
To return (someone) to good health after illness, addiction etc.
To go through such a process; to recover.
To bend deeply at the knees while resting on one's feet.
(exercise) To perform one or more callisthenic exercises by moving the body and bending at least one knee.
To occupy or reside in a place without the permission of the owner.
To sit close to the ground; to cower; to stoop, or lie close, to escape observation, as a partridge or rabbit.
To bruise or flatten by a fall; to squash.
The posture of one who squats.
The act or general practice of occupying a building or land without the permission of the owner.
In a cordial, warm or friendly manner.
An expendable person or object; usually used in the plural.
definitions.example: Private Johnson was afraid the Lieutenant considered him an expendable, since he was always picked as point man.

definitions.definition: Able to be expended; not inexhaustible.
definitions.example: Oil and other expendable resources are frequently the subject of military disputes.

definitions.definition: Designed for a single use; not reusable.
definitions.example: The anti-aircraft rocket is fired from an expendable launch platform.

definitions.definition: Not essential or mandatory in order to achieve a goal.
definitions.example: The research department was deemed expendable, and its funding was not renewed.

definitions.definition: Regarded as not worth preserving or saving; able to be sacrificed.
definitions.example: In the internecine rivalries of large corporations, whole departments may become expendable in the execution of one executive's power play.

definitions.definition: To yield to an overpowering force or overwhelming desire.
definitions.example: Thai culture as in many other Asian cultures, is succumbing to the influence of westernization.

definitions.definition: To give up, or give in.
To die.
definitions.example: succumb to pneumonia

definitions.definition: To overwhelm or bring down.
Someone, especially a romantic partner, with whom one is exceptionally or uniquely compatible or has a special, almost spiritual connection.
A coat or skirt having such a hemline
A class of racing sailing yacht that pushes at the upper limits of the International Offshore Rule of regulated sail yacht racing, having a waterline length in excess of 70-feet.
A music single with more than two tracks, i.e. not just an A-side and a B-side.
A maxi boat
The highest limit
The greatest value of a set or other mathematical structure, especially the global maximum or a local maximum of a function
An upper bound of a set which is also an element of that set
The largest value of a batch or sample or the upper bound of a probability distribution
A 147 break; the highest possible break
A score of 180 with three darts
A scoring shot for 6 runs
A small carton of fruit juice with an attached plastic straw.
One who or that which pops.
A dagger.
A short piece of twisted string tied to the end of a whip that creates the distinctive sound when the whip is thrown or cracked.
A capsule of amyl nitrite for recreational use as a sexual stimulant.

Either of a pair of interlocking discs commonly used in place of buttons to fasten clothing, a snap fastener.
A device that pops kernels of corn to produce popcorn.
A stuffed and usually breaded jalapeño.
A looner (balloon fetishist) who prefers to burst balloons.
A belief or beliefs, not based on human reason or scientific knowledge, that events may be influenced by one's behaviour in some magical or mystical way.
Excessive nicety; overscrupulousness.
A book in which appointments are kept, each listed beside the day when it occurs.
To sparkle, flash or coruscate.

Having spangles.
The floor or bottom of the sea or ocean.
To make complex; to modify so as to make something intricate or difficult.
To involve in a convoluted matter.

definitions.definition: To create or apply a texture

definitions.definition: Friendly discussion.
Reciprocal exchange of civilities, especially conversation between persons by means of letters.
An agreement of situations or objects with an expected outcome.
Newspaper or news stories, generally.
A postal or other written communication.
Postal or other written communications.
A relation.
According to Swedenborg, a relationship of similarity between physical and spiritual things, such as that of light to wisdom, or warmth to love.
A man who serves as one of a number of attendants to a bridegroom at a wedding, one of whom is the best man.
The residence of Roman Catholic priest(s) associated with a parish church.
The residence of an Anglican rector.
A subdivision of currency, equal to one hundredth of a Macanese pataca.
The large, usually yellowish-green or black, pulpy fruit of the avocado tree.
The avocado tree, Persea americana, of the laurel family.
A dark chartreuse colour, like the colour of the skin of an avocado.
A vertical panel, either plain or upholstered, attached to the head of a bed.
A panel, usually of metal, attached to the head of a fore-and-aft sail for additional strength.
A board on the front of a train, carrying the train's name or that of the service it is on.
A grave marker made of wood.
A horse with a golden-colored coat and a white or cream-colored mane and tail.
A native, or inhabitant of Pomerania.
A breed of small, fluffy, energetic toy dogs in the canine family of spitzes.
The act of grazing; a scratching or injuring lightly on passing.
A light abrasion; a slight scratch.
The act of animals feeding from pasture.
To feed or supply (cattle, sheep, etc.) with grass; to furnish pasture for.

definitions.definition: To feed on; to eat (growing herbage); to eat grass from (a pasture)
definitions.example: Cattle graze in the meadows.

definitions.definition: To tend (cattle, etc.) while grazing.
To eat periodically throughout the day, rather than at fixed mealtimes.
To shoplift by consuming food or drink items before reaching the checkout.
To rub or touch lightly the surface of (a thing) in passing.

definitions.definition: To cause a slight wound to; to scratch.
definitions.example: to graze one's knee

definitions.definition: To yield grass for grazing.
To form something into a loop.
To fasten or encircle something with a loop.
To fly an aircraft in a loop.
To move something in a loop.
To join electrical components to complete a circuit.
To duplicate the route of a pipeline.
To create an error in a computer program so that it runs in an endless loop and the computer freezes up.
To form a loop.
To move in a loop.

definitions.definition: Having loops
Formed into a loop
(of part of a fingerprint) whorled
Drunk
An anucleate hemoglobin-containing cell, especially as found in humans but more generally present in the blood of most vertebrates, that is involved with the transport of oxygen; a red blood cell.
Not noticeable or blatant; inconspicuous.
A white, fatty material, composed of lipids and lipoproteins, that surrounds the axons of nerves.
The condition or quality of being fragile; brittleness; frangibility.
Weakness; feebleness.
Liability to error and sin; frailty.
To bill; to issue an invoice to.

definitions.definition: To make an invoice for (goods or services).

The fruit of various shrubs of the genus Ribes, white, black or red.

A pad, with an enhanced surface to assist the operation of a display pointer.
One who is in charge of, or performs the task of creating, collecting, cataloguing, and organising, archives.
definitions.example: The billionaire’s will established a trust to create a staff of archivists that would chronicle and preserve his rise to prominence.

definitions.definition: To lie in a position directly beneath.
To lie under or beneath.
definitions.example: A stratum of clay underlies the surface gravel.

definitions.definition: To serve as a basis of; form the foundation of.
definitions.example: a doctrine underlying a theory

definitions.definition: To be subject to; be liable to answer, as a charge or challenge.
To underlay.
The state or quality of being intricate or entangled.

definitions.definition: Perplexity
Something which is intricate or complex.

definitions.definition: A bone of a herring
A zigzag pattern, especially made by bricks, on a cloth, or by stitches in sewing
A method of climbing a hill by pointing the skis outward in a V-shape to keep from sliding backwards.
Twilled fabric woven in rows of parallel sloping lines
To stitch in a herringbone pattern.
To climb a hill by pointing the skis outward in a V-shape to keep from sliding backwards.

On foot. (means of locomotion, walking)

An odd or strange thing or opinion.
A strange person; an oddball.
Strangeness.
The red grouse.
To drive (someone or something) into a corner or other confined space.

definitions.definition: To put (someone) in an awkward situation.
To get sufficient command of (a stock, commodity, etc.), so as to be able to manipulate its price.
definitions.example: It's extremely hard to corner the petroleum market because there are so many players.

definitions.definition: To turn a corner or drive around a curve.
definitions.example: As the stock car driver cornered the last turn, he lost control and spun out.

definitions.example: That BMW corners well, but the suspension is too stiff.

definitions.definition: To supply with corners.
Makeup used to outline the eye, generally applied along or close to the lashline.
To add up; to calculate the sum of.

definitions.definition: To equal a total of; to amount to.
definitions.example: That totals seven times so far.

definitions.definition: To demolish; to wreck completely. (from total loss)

definitions.definition: To amount to; to add up to.
definitions.example: It totals nearly a pound.

definitions.definition: Destroyed

definitions.definition: Of good omen; indicating future success.
Conducive to success.
definitions.example: This is an auspicious day.

definitions.definition: Marked by success; prosperous.
(often followed by up) To stop sleeping.
definitions.example: I woke up at four o'clock this morning.

definitions.definition: (often followed by up) To make somebody stop sleeping; to rouse from sleep.
definitions.example: The neighbour's car alarm woke me from a strange dream.

definitions.definition: To put in motion or action; to arouse; to excite.
To be excited or roused up; to be stirred up from a dormant, torpid, or inactive state; to be active.
To lay out a body prior to burial in order to allow family and friends to pay their last respects.
To watch, or sit up with, at night, as a dead body.
To be or remain awake; not to sleep.
To be alert; to keep watch

definitions.definition: To sit up late for festive purposes; to hold a night revel.
To hit or agitate liquid so that part of it separates from the principal liquid mass.

definitions.definition: To disperse a fluid suddenly; to splatter.

definitions.definition: To hit or expel liquid at

definitions.definition: To create an impact or impression; to print, post or publicize prominently.
definitions.example: The headline was splashed across newspapers everywhere.

definitions.definition: To spend (money)
definitions.example: After pay day I can afford to splash some cash and buy myself a motorbike.

definitions.definition: To launch a ship.
To stab (a person), causing them to bleed.
An action that splashes.

definitions.definition: Sapsucking pest insect of the superfamily Aphidoidea; an aphidian.
With great amounts of heat
In a heated manner; intensely or vehemently
A murderer who slits the throats of victims.
An unscrupulous, ruthless or unethical person.

Happening or existing at the same time.

To cross one with another.

Any particular kind of petroleum jelly or of any similar lubricant.
A greenish-yellow coloured glass, or the colouring used in the manufacture of this glass.

definitions.definition: Oceangoing, capable of travelling in rough seas.

definitions.definition: One of a series of parts, whether equal or unequal to the other parts of the series, of a given entity or a given process, which part presents or is presented at a particular scheduled interval.

One member of a series of portions of a debt or sum of money, which portions may or may not be equated (depending in part on whether the interest rate is fixed or variable), payment of which portions are serially exacted at regularly scheduled intervals toward satisfaction of the total. Payments of installments are generally mensual, quarterly, triannual, biannual, or annual.
A part of a published or broadcast serial.
The act of installing; installation.
The seat in which one is placed.
The metallic chemical element (symbol Sr) with an atomic number of 38. It is a soft, reactive, silvery alkaline earth metal.
A single atom of this element.
Based on presumption, probability, conjecture, hypothesis or belief.

definitions.definition: Making presumptions; behaving as one who presumes, who assumes that which they perhaps should not.

definitions.definition: Of, pertaining to, or forming a crust, especially the crust of the Earth or other planet.
Able to be comprehended.

To entice or induce (someone) to engage in a sexual relationship.

definitions.definition: To win over or attract.

definitions.definition: Of a person, not showing emotion; calm and in control of oneself.
Unenthusiastic, lukewarm, skeptical.

definitions.definition: Calmly audacious.

definitions.definition: Applied facetiously to a sum of money, commonly as if to give emphasis to the largeness of the amount.
Of a person, knowing what to do and how to behave; considered popular by others.

definitions.definition: Of a person, not upset by circumstances that might ordinarily be upsetting.
definitions.example: I'm completely cool with my girlfriend leaving me.

definitions.definition: Quietly impudent, defiant, or selfish; deliberately presuming: said of persons and acts.
A light source that projects a bright beam of light in any direction, generally for military use.
The light from the above source.
To scan or sweep across like a searchlight.
Moving in two directions (usually opposite).
Operating or functioning in two directions (usually opposite).

Anything resembling the leaf of a plant.
A sheet of any substance beaten or rolled until very thin.

(in the plural) Tea leaves.
A flat section used to extend the size of a table.

definitions.definition: A foliage leaf or any of the many and often considerably different structures it can specialise into.
In a tree, a node that has no descendants.
The layer of fat supporting the kidneys of a pig, leaf fat.
One of the teeth of a pinion, especially when small.
Marijuana.

The act or process of shaping in or on a mold, or of making molds; the art or occupation of a molder.
Anything cast in a mold, or which appears to be so, as grooved or ornamental bars of wood or metal.
A plane, or curved, narrow surface, either sunk or projecting, used for decoration by means of the lights and shades upon its surface and to conceal joints, especially between unlike materials.
(woodwork) A planing machine for making moldings.
(founding) A machine to assist in making molds for castings.
(milling) A mill for shaping timber.
(founding) A kind of sand containing clay, used in making molds.
A person who wishes to be seen as a member of the upper classes and who looks down on those perceived to have inferior or unrefined tastes.
A cobbler or shoemaker.
A member of the lower classes; a commoner.
A workman who works for lower wages than his fellows, or who will not join a strike.

A light part song, frequently with a fa-la-la chorus, common among Elizabethan and Italian Renaissance composers.
A bearing in coats of arms representing one or more balls, called bezants, plates, etc., according to colour.
Any intricate series of operations involving coordination between individuals.
Flight into, from or through space.
A voyage in space.
The property of being proportional
The principle that government action ought to be proportional to the ends achieved (e.g. the military should not be deployed to stop petty vandalism)
The degree to which something is in proportion
An instance of overrunning
The amount by which something overruns

definitions.definition: Air that is whipped into a frozen dessert to make it easier to serve and eat.
To defeat an enemy and invade in great numbers, seizing the enemy positions conclusively.
To infest, swarm over, flow over.

definitions.definition: To run past; to run beyond.

definitions.definition: To continue for too long.
definitions.example: The performance overran by ten minutes, which caused some people to miss their bus home.

definitions.definition: To carry (some type, a line or column, etc.) backward or forward into an adjacent line or page.
To go beyond; to extend in part beyond.
definitions.example: In machinery, a sliding piece is said to overrun its bearing when its forward end goes beyond it.

definitions.definition: To abuse or oppress, as if by treading upon.

One of a number of narrow strips of wood, or narrow iron plates, placed edge to edge to form the sides, covering, or lining of a vessel or structure; especially, one of the strips which form the sides of a cask, a pail, etc.
One of the bars or rounds of a rack, rungs of a ladder, etc; one of the cylindrical bars of a lantern wheel
A metrical portion; a stanza; a staff.

The removal of air bubbles from a pipe containing other fluids.

definitions.definition: To remove air bubbles from a pipe containing other fluids.
To bleed on; to make bloody.

Written Presidential certificate recognizing service by personnel who died or were wounded in action between 1917 and 1918, or who died in service between 1941 and 1947, or died of wounds received in Korea between June 27, 1950 and July 27, 1954. Service of civilians who died overseas or as a result of injury or disease contracted while serving in a civilian capacity with the United States Armed Forces during the dates and/or in areas prescribed is in like manner recognized.

An ornament composed of two ogee curves meeting in the middle, each concave toward its outer extremity and convex toward the point at which it meets the other. Such accolades are either plain or adorned with rich moldings, and are a frequent motive of decoration on the lintels of doors and windows of the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries, especially in secular architecture.

Either of the two characters { and }, i.e., left curly bracket left curly bracket and right curly bracket right curly bracket, with the shape of a curved, pointed line, having various uses in math, music, and computer programming.

Any plant of the genus Carex, the true sedge, perennial, endogenous herbs, often growing in dense tufts in marshy places. They have triangular jointless stems, a spiked inflorescence, and long grasslike leaves which are usually rough on the margins and midrib. There are several hundred species.
